item.title: Tech update: Multiple JupyterHubs, multiple clusters, one repository.
item.description: This blog was originally posted by 2i2c and represents a project Sarah lead and developed.

item.title: Things I've Learned: January 2022
item.description: An Unordered Collection of Things I Learn over a Month

item.title: How I automated authorised cloud deployments from Pull Requests with GitHub Actions
item.description:
This blog was originally posted on the Jupyter blog: https://blog.jupyter.org/how-i-automated-authorised-cloud-deployments-from-pull-requests-with-github-actions-13f890538e32

I recently did some work on the mybinder.org deployment infrastructure to solve a problem with testing Pull Requests before deployment. It had not been possible to test Pull Requests on our staging deployment because our automated workflows don’t have access to secrets. This resulted in my writing the test-this-pr action and this blog is a retrospective of what I learned over that process.

item.title: Create a Blog with Hugo and GitHub Pages
item.description: As a scientist in today’s ever connected, digital world, having a platform to talk about one’s work can be a really useful tool. Whether you’re looking to strike up new collaborations or promote your freshly published paper, a blog can help signal boost your work and function as an archive of your ideas (the developed and forgotten).

item.title: Continuous Integration: Fail Fast and Fail First
item.description: How to industry and academia take advantage of shared tools

item.title: February 2020 Update
item.description: Hello friends! 👋 It feels like such a long time since I wrote a blog post but the truth is that I’ve just been up to so many exciting things! So this blog post will be a quick run down on everything I’ve been up to recently.

item.title: Software Sustainability Institute Fellowship 2020
item.description:
So 2020 is off to an incredibly exciting start!

I have been awarded a Software Sustainability Institute 2020 Fellowship!!! 🎉 🎉 🎉

item.title: 2019: Seasons of Reflection
item.description: As 2019 comes to a close, I have spent a full year as a Research Software Engineer (RSE) at The Alan Turing Institute. A lot has changed over the last 12 months and I’ve come a long way - sometimes surprising myself!
